article:
This is a list of archeological sites where remains or tools of Neanderthals
were found.

* Western Europe north of the Alps and Pyrenees ** Ehringsdorf (Germany)
  Protoneanderthals ** Engis (Belgium) Protoneanderthals ** La Naulette
  (Belgium) Classic Neanderthals ** Neander Valley (Germany) Classic
  Neanderthals ** Northsea shore, (Netherlands) Classic Neanderthals ** Salzgitter-
  Lebenstedt (Germany) Classic Neanderthals ** Sclayn (Belgium)
  Protoneanderthals ** Spy-sur-l'Orneau (Belgium) Classic Neanderthals ** Veldwezelt-
  Hezerwater (Belgium) Protoneanderthals ** Bontnewydd, Llanelwy (Wales) Proto-
  Neanderthals. Most northwesterly hominid remains of this early age (230,000
  BP) in Eurasia. {{cite web |title= Gathering the Jewels
  |url=http://www.gtj.org.uk/en/small/item/GTJ27306/ |accessdate=2008-09-25
  |publisher=Culturenet Cymru |year=2008 |work=Early Neanderthal jaw fragment,
  c. 230,000 years old }} ** La Cotte de St Brelade (Jersey) ** Arcy-sur-
  Cure (France) Classic Neanderthals ** Bau de l'Aubesier (France)
  Protoneanderthals ** Biache-Saint-Vaast (France) Protoneanderthals ** Combe

  Neanderthals ** Moula-Guercy (France) Classic Neanderthals ** Regourdou
  (France) Classic Neanderthals ** St-CÃ©saire (France) Classic Neanderthals **
  Lynford Quarry (England)

* Central and Eastern Europe ** Divje Babe (Slovenia) Classic Neanderthals **
